name: Bactrian Camel
description: The Bactrian Camel is a two-humped herbivore, known for its endurance in harsh climates.
spread_note: Found in Central Asia, including Mongolia and China.
food_note: Can survive long periods without water.
proportions: Height: 1.8-2.3 m, length: 3-4 m, weight: 450-1,000 kg.
reproduction: Gestation about 13 months, one calf born.
attractions: Common in zoos for their unique humps and resilience.
projects_note: Critically endangered in the wild; conservation focuses on breeding.
breeding: Widely bred in captivity for zoos and domestication.
